bibl.title: Letter from Louis H. Bauer to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1952

div1.p: Bauer regrets that he cannot attend the Camp Lazear dedication but will suggest that the American Medical Association be represented there.

div1.head: Letter from Louis H. Bauer to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1952
div1.opener:
LOUIS H. BAUER, M.D.
PRESIDENT
American Medical Association
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
131 Fulton Avenue, HEMPSTEAD, NEW YORK,
November 21, 1952
P. S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p: I received your letter of November 19th.

I was invited to attend the ceremony
on December 3rd, but, unfortunately, it
conflicts with the Interim Session of the
American Medical Association so I had to
decline.

I think your suggestion, however, is an
excellent one and I have written Doctor Lull
and asked that something be done to bring
the A.M.A. into the ceremony.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, L. H. Bauer, M.D. B:H
